_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
January 17th, 1:20 PM
Adventurers, assemble! The gateway between kingdoms is making its debut. Slide Brook Express begins its season at 10:00 AM today, unlocking a full mountain-to-mountain quest across Sugarbush. Grab your crew, grab your stoke, and hop aboard. Tomorrow's forecast is calling for cloudy skies and temps in the high teens to low 20s at the summit and mid to high 20s at the base. Get excited for prime conditions all around the mountain, we have firm groomers with light snow to push around and packed-powder conditions on natural terrain. Snowmaking at Lincoln Peak will be firing tonight on Hotshot, Waterfall, Lower Hotshot, Overshot, and Second Thoughts. At Mt. Ellen, Brambles and Inverness are getting some refills; snowmaking is planned to shut off before opening lifts. These trails will remain open but are suggested for advanced skiers and riders as conditions are variable.

We will be getting down on 484 skiable acres served by 16 lifts and 111 open trails, 45 of which received fresh grooming overnight. Castlerock and North Lynx lifts will be spinning today from 9:00 AM 3:45 PM. All natural terrain is recommended for experts only, as conditions are variable. Check out Gate House terrain for some mellow and easy-going groomers, perfect for the kiddos, beginners, or anyone looking for a good time. Inverness will be closed tomorrow until 10:30 AM for race training. Racer's Edge is open to the public for racing, folks interested in racing, can buy a race ticket for the NASTAR course at the top shack.

Operations have switched to weekend hours, meaning GMX, Super Bravo, and Heaven's Gate will kick things off loading at 8:00 AM, followed by all other scheduled lifts at 9:00 AM, with the exception of Slide Brook at 10:00 AM. Sugarbush offers freestyle fun for all levels! At Mt. Ellen you'll find over 80 of the finest features on the East Coast located on Riemergasse, and another 27 features on Sugar Run, serviced by the one and only Sunny Quad. At Lincoln Peak, features on Slowpoke have been removed for a rebuild later this week, but fun rolling snow mounds still remain, also 7 fun freestyle features remain on Sugarbear Forest.

Play Blizzard Bingo all month long! As a part of NSAA Safety Month, you can play and learn across Sugarbush this January. Join us on select days at Mt. Ellen and Lincoln Peak for demonstrations, interactive experiences, and more with our very own Ski Patrol. Today's safety tidbit is Stay In Control. Fun for all ages, join us this January for an unforgettable NSAA Safety Month! Check out all of our winter events, as we have loads of fun activities all weekend!

All uphill routes are open at both Lincoln Peak and Mt. Ellen, check out our uphill travel policy for more info. *Gate House terrain will have active snowmaking, use caution. Cliff, Tumbler, and Hammerhead will be closed due to grooming*
